channel.title: COEY Cast
channel.description: COEY Cast is your daily download on AI and automation. We break down the latest in generative models, intelligent workflows, and emerging tools—giving marketers, operators, and business leaders the insights they need to move faster and scale smarter. From AI video and audio to end-to-end automation pipelines, each episode turns complex breakthroughs into clear, actionable takeaways you can actually use.
channel.itunes:author: COEY
channel.itunes:summary: COEY Cast is your daily download on AI and automation. We break down the latest in generative models, intelligent workflows, and emerging tools—giving marketers, operators, and business leaders the insights they need to move faster and scale smarter. From AI video and audio to end-to-end automation pipelines, each episode turns complex breakthroughs into clear, actionable takeaways you can actually use.

item.title: Qwen3-Max-Preview: Scaling to a Trillion & Beyond
item.description: This week, we put Alibaba’s Qwen3-Max-Preview to the test—a trillion-parameter upgrade promising smoother instruction following, longer conversational threads, and genuine tool-calling power for creators and teams. We discuss what “scaling works” actually means for daily workflows: less prompt wrangling, better agents for chaining tasks, and practical examples like video content pipelines and brand campaigns. We break down the differences from previous Qwen3 models, compare real-world pros and cons, and share best practices for validation, safety, and using multi-step automations. By the end, you’ll know how Qwen3-Max-Preview can streamline content ops and whether it’s worth plugging into your stack, solo or at scale.

item.title: Seven Ways to Keep Your AI Video in Line: Vidu Q1 Update
item.description: This episode dives into the massive Reference-to-Video update for ShengShu Technology’s Vidu Q1 model, which now lets users upload up to seven reference images per sequence. Hunter and Riley unpack what this means for creators, brands, and indie studios striving for true shot-to-shot consistency in AI-generated video. They explore how multiple references help lock character identity, props, wardrobe, and backgrounds, reducing the notorious continuity drift. Expect a breakdown of workflow tips, common pitfalls, competitive comparisons with Runway and Luma, use cases from social content to ad pipelines, and where this tech sits in the growing stack for marketers and content teams. Don’t miss practical advice on setting up your own "reference kit".

item.title: Firefly Boards & Model 4: Idea to Approval Fast-Tracked
item.description: Today, we battle test Microsoft VibeVoice 7B and dive deep into Adobe’s Firefly Image Model 4 and Firefly Boards. Discover what makes Model 4 a leap ahead for creatives. Hands and eyes look human, image quality is up, and styles stay consistent across channels and platforms. Firefly Boards lets you co-create, share, get feedback, and iterate— all right inside Creative Cloud, without back-and-forth emails. Automation tips abound: learn to trigger batch image and video generation from intake forms, streamline approvals, and nail brand consistency. Pros, cons, and practical workflow hacks for solo creators, marketers, and global teams are covered. Plus, the automation blueprint to get your campaigns from prompt to publish with less busywork.

item.title: Unlimited B-Roll Bonanza: Envato’s AI Video September
item.description: Dive into this episode where we break down Envato's game-changing move to lift AI video generation limits in VideoGen for all of September. Learn how creators, marketers, and agencies can generate unlimited AI-powered videos, leveraging powerful models like Google Veo 3 and Kling. We walk through smart workflows, automation hacks, and practical advice for building b-roll libraries, all while securing lifetime commercial licenses for every video made this month. Hear tips for prompt-writing, quality control, and maximizing your creative output. Plus, get the lowdown on how Envato’s all-you-can-generate September compares to Runway, Pika, and Luma. Whether you’re a solo content creator or an enterprise team, this episode is your blueprint for making the most of unlimited AI video.

item.title: Unchunk the Funk: Exploring Nvidia Rubin CPX
item.description: This episode is a deep dive into Nvidia's Rubin CPX, the new AI chip designed to revolutionize long-form generative media. We explain how CPX combines lightning-fast media engines with massive context memory, putting an end to mid-project memory loss and timeline fragmentation. Discover the tech behind real-time dubbing that captures performance, code copilots that see your whole repository, and enterprise use cases for seamless translation and editing. We break down numbers, architecture, and the real impact for creators, marketers, and solo podcasters. Hear about upcoming workflows, cost economics, competition, and potential pitfalls. If you want to future-proof your creative pipeline and see how hardware is finally keeping up with creatives, this one’s for you.

item.title: AI Highlights: Synamedia’s Stack Powers Smart Streaming
item.description: This episode breaks down Synamedia’s bold move at IBC 2025 as they launch a stacked AI layer for video pros—creators, broadcasters, and streamers. Riley and Hunter explore how conversational search brings instant highlight discovery, live tagging powers fast editing, and creative personalization delivers tailored promos for key segments. Learn how the new multi-CDN switching and ContentArmor watermarking tech make livestreams more reliable and secure. Plus, we dive into Synamedia’s open standards push, AI-powered quality tuning, and the blend of creative and operational gains. If you work with video at any scale, this episode covers why Synamedia’s AI stack might change your workflow—from auto-tagging goals to cutting bandwidth bills and getting content out faster.

item.title: Agentic Marketing: Adobe’s AEP Agents Take the Wheel
item.description: In this episode, Hunter and Riley break down Adobe’s launch of AI-powered agents inside the Adobe Experience Platform (AEP), featuring the new Agent Orchestrator. Learn how six specialized agents—Audience, Journey, Experimentation, Data Insights, Site Optimization, and Product Support—work together to automate segmentation, journeys, testing, reporting, site updates, and customer support. Discover practical use cases, potential risks, and the impact for marketing ops and enterprise teams. The hosts discuss real workflow savings and why this shifts agentic marketing from hype to reality. Whether you’re a marketer in a large org or a solo creator curious about automation patterns, you’ll get actionable insights and ways to apply the blueprint to your own stack.

item.title: Ollama on ARM: Local LLMs Go Pro, No Cloud Needed
item.description: This episode dives into Ollama’s latest update: true native support for Apple Silicon, Linux ARM, and Windows on ARM—plus automatic GPU acceleration. Hunter and Riley break down what this means for creators, marketers, and teams who want fast, private, and scalable local AI without the cloud headaches. Discover how to automate copywriting, captions, content moderation, product Q&A, and more with local LLMs that actually ship real projects. Get practical workflow tips for solo makers, agency teams, and brands—including how to wire up n8n for end-to-end automation. Learn where local AI now beats the cloud in speed, privacy, and cost, what hardware you’ll need, and what snags to expect on day one. Local workflow, global impact.

item.title: Persona-Party: Meta AI Studio Slides Into DMs
item.description: This episode dives into Meta’s newly launched AI Studio, a no-code platform for spinning up custom AI characters directly in Instagram, Messenger, WhatsApp, and web. Learn how creators and brands can deploy persona-driven assistants in hours, gather audience insights, and streamline DM engagement—without developers. The hosts cover real-world use cases for solo creators, D2C brands, agencies, and enterprise teams, examining automation possibilities, integration limits, pricing, and competitive landscape. You’ll get quick tips for campaign ideation, lead qualification, and making the most of current API options like WhatsApp Cloud and Instagram Messaging flows. Plus, hear why this is a must-have for DM-heavy brands and what unlocks true orchestration whenever public APIs arrive.

item.title: Zoom AI Companion 3.0: Avatars, Notes & 60FPS Oh My!
item.description: This episode crash-tests Zoom AI Companion 3.0, just announced at Zoomtopia. We dig into photorealistic avatars that mirror your every move, cross-platform automatic meeting notes that work in Zoom, Teams, and Google Meet, and agent-style scheduling that might finally end meeting exhaustion. We break down who benefits most—from solo creators who want flawless presence to marketing managers juggling endless calls. There’s a look at HD and 60FPS video upgrades, new automation potential, and bold pricing moves that challenge notetaker apps like Otter and Fireflies. Tune in for tips on integrating AI Companion into your workflow, honest caveats, security pointers, and skeptical optimism about the future of AI-powered meetings. Plus, plenty of memes about sending your avatar instead.

item.title: Voxel Revolution: Hunyuan 3D 3.0 Unleashed
item.description: Dive into Hunyuan 3D 3.0 by Tencent, the latest leap in text or image-to-3D generation. Hosts Hunter and Riley dissect its features, including boosted accuracy, denser geometry, sharper edges, and the standout ability to reconstruct hidden parts of objects. Learn how new automation options with API access can overhaul your workflow for e-commerce, games, social content, and more. The episode explores practical use cases for creators and organizations, workflow integration tips, pricing, file compatibility, and the realities versus the hype. Plus, get a quick-start playbook to test it in your pipeline. Whether you craft digital assets for fun or run a 3D factory, this episode arms you with what’s new, what works, and where to watch out.

item.title: Ray3 & Firefly: AI Video Levels Up in Adobe’s Playground
item.description: Dive into Luma’s Ray3, now turbocharging Adobe Firefly with ten-second AI video generation, native HDR in ACES EXR, and scene-level planning. We break down what 'reasoning' for video means and why direct handoff into Creative Cloud is such a big deal for creators and marketers. From quick Draft Mode explorations to full quality cinematic moments, Ray3’s integration offers workflow magic: brand-safe templating, fixed color pipelines, and time-saving edits. We cover draft vs final workflows, competitive pressure for Runway and Pika, automation possibilities, limitations, and real-world applications for TikTokers, marketers, and small teams. Is this a toy or essential tool? We map out who should care and what comes next in the pipeline!
